executive_summary: The industry has grown rapidly over the past five years, withstanding the COVID-19 pandemic to reach new heights. The industry has benefited as interest in agritourism has risen, driven by consumers' interest in connecting with the food supply chain as concerns about sustainability have grown. Farms have sought to expand their agritourism services from simple direct-to-consumer sales and education to entertainment activities like petting zoos and even higher revenue accommodation offerings. This has propelled the industry to grow at a CAGR of 3.6% to $1.7 billion over the past five years, including an expected boost of 3.0% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Agritourism Has Boomed Along With Greater Consumer Interest
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Millennials already comprise the largest generational demographic in the United States and the Gen Z cohort will increasingly enter the workforce over the coming years. With greater disposable income to spend, these groups will seek out unique experiences at tourist farms and petting zoos. Eager to diversify revenue streams by adding new services, ever more farms will expand into the industry, with many seeking subsidies at all levels of government. Consequently, revenue is expected to shoot up at a CAGR of 3.2% to $2.0 billion over the next five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Despite the COVID-19 Pandemic, the Industry Bounced Back Quickly
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses have taken note, expanding the services they offer in an effort to capitalize on consumer demand. Petting zoos and tourist farms faced difficult conditions during the COVID-19 pandemic, as shutdowns and distancing measures forced businesses to close for much of 2020. In turn, revenue contracted and profit likewise cratered as consumers stayed away from in-person activities. However, agritourism was perceived as a safe recreational activity following the outset of the COVID-19 pandemic because most activities take place outdoors. So farms saw a boom in demand, with revenue jumping nearly 50.0% in 2021 alone. With industry establishments rushing to expand services in line with unprecedented demand, profit margins quickly eclipsed their pre-pandemic levels.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: With Greater Incomes, Younger Consumers Will Continue to Drive Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Younger consumers will continue to drive demand for tourist farms. These consumers have become increasingly concerned about the source of their food and about climate change, which will drive them to visit industry establishments in an effort to learn more about the agricultural supply chains.

Millennials, already the largest demographic cohort in the United States, will continue to grow. Likewise, the next demographic cohort, Gen Z, will increasingly enter the workforce. With stable economic growth projected along with widening disposable income levels, younger consumers will be better positioned to spend more on an array of activities offered by tourist farms and petting zoos.

Tourist farms will look to market to younger consumers via direct-to-consumer marketing like farmers markets and direct-to-retail food sales like selling to restaurants in an effort to attract these consumers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Will Look for Additional Government Support
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The federal government has historically played a primary role in agriculture, providing subsidies for a range of commodities. So the industry will also continue to look for government assistance to expand. A myriad of subsidies exist at the state, regional and local levels to support tourist farms and petting zoos, providing farmers with additional sources of revenue. In 2023, legislators introduced the AGRITOURISM Act, which would create an Office of Agritourism at the federal level and to consolidate federal resources to sustain agritourism businesses, such as loans, grants, and broadband connectivity programs.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry engage in agricultural activities that bring visitors to farms, including the preservation and exhibition of animal life displays at which visitors may handle and feed animals.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: Low - Steady

key_trends: The industry has grown quickly as farms have tried to diversify income streams, catering to the increased interest in farm tourism.
Agrotourism has grown on account of a rise in consumer consciousness about sustainability, driving interest in connecting with the food supply chain.

The COVID-19 pandemic created substantial volatility for petting zoos and tourist farms, forcing many to close their doors temporarily at the height of the pandemic. But as consumers returned from pandemic lockdowns, industry establishments have been prime beneficiaries of greater spending.

Tourist farms receive a range of government subsidies, in addition to broader funding for farming output in the United States. Agritourism subsidies vary considerably across states, regions and localities.
Animal farms have been among the biggest beneficiaries of sustainability trends. Among all animal farms, beef and cattle ranches represent the most popular destination for farm tourism.
Younger consumers are the largest market for tourist farms and petting zoos
Millennials have particularly shown an interest in learning more about local food chains.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Younger individuals, especially millennials, represent the largest downstream consumer market for agritourism. Younger populations have shown an eagerness to connect with their food sources.
The second-largest segment is consumers aged 30 to 40, accounting for 24.2% of the market.
Consumers aged 40 to 50 tend to be more health-conscious and have more disposable income. This enables them to spend more lavishly on premium experiences, like farm-to-table meals.
Middle-aged consumers are also more likely to be parents of young children, an important draw to petting zoos and tourist farms.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at All Other Animal Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms raising animals other than beef cattle, dairy cattle, hogs, poultry, sheep or goats.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at Beef and Cattle Ranch Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms that raise cattle, including for dairy herd replacements, or feeding cattle to fatten and prepare them for consumption.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at Fruit and Tree Nut Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms growing fruit and tree nuts.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at Sugarcane, Hay and Other Crop Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms growing sugarcane, hay and other crops.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at All Other Grain Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms growing grains other than wheat, corn, rice or soybeans.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Agritourist Activities at Vegetable and Melon Farms
products_and_services.product_description: Agritourism activities at farms growing vegetables and melons.

tier_2_suppliers: Tractors & Agricultural Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Woodworking Machinery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Growing consumer interest in sustainability has spurred interest in farm tourism at beef and cattle ranch farms.
Beef and cattle ranch farms are a popular destination for farm-to-table dining experiences.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region of the United States.
The Mid-Atlantic region of the United States.
The New England region of the United States.
The Plains region of the United States.
The Rocky Mountains region of the United States.
The Southeast region of the United States.
The Southwest region of the United States.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Establishing petting zoo and tourist farm operations is relatively straightforward
barriers_points.barrier_description: Establishing petting zoo and tourist farm operations is relatively straightforward, as establishments draw clientele locally.

basis_points.basis_description: Agritourism is highly competitive because buyers have a multitude of options to choose from, especially as more farms establish tourist activities and open petting zoos.

basis_points.basis_title: Differentiated service offerings can create demand beyond local markets
basis_points.basis_description: However, establishments that are able to successfully differentiate their service offerings can create demand beyond local markets, thereby raising prices.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Petting zoo and tourist farm operations are highly fragmented
concentration_points.concentration_description: Petting zoo and tourist farm operations are highly fragmented. Establishments compete with other farms regionally, drawing clientele locally.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Larger operations through differentiated offerings and brand identity
concentration_points.concentration_description: While many consumers select agritourism activities from regional options, companies are able to establish larger operations by creating differentiated offerings and establishing brand identity.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Produced a Wild Swing in Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: COVID-19 led to restrictions on travel, gatherings and indoor activities, which significantly impacted revenue for the petting zoos and tourist farms. Following the abatement of restrictions, the agritourism business saw a resurgence in demand as Americans were eager to get outdoors and resume leisure activities.

FAQs.question: What is the industry regulation status?
FAQs.answer: The regulation status is described as high and steady.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The industry assistance is described as moderate but increasing.
